intro: Psittacanthus cinctus, commonly known as the golden button fern, is a species of fern native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant features small, bright green fronds with a distinctive golden hue on the underside, which gives it its common name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, moist soil. Psittacanthus cinctus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of care.
